item.description: It is not too late to reverse bad policy but that requires good governance

item.description: Financial gamification has upended traditional patterns of trust and oversight

item.title: Time to find sustenance in a renewed flowering of botanical art
item.description: While flower beds slumber through the British winter, artists are at work capturing their beauty. But the genre is too often under-appreciated

item.description: CEO turnover at US public companies is running at its highest level since 2010

item.description: Crime and violence are raising the appeal of strongmen across the region

item.description: Sector companies are seeking to show that time saved on one-off tasks can translate into real-world business value

item.title: The hard politics of climate overshoot
item.description: Net zero is difficult enough — but an age of net negative emissions goals would be far tougher

item.description: Core goals for 2026 must be survival — to kill off Farage’s claim that only he can offer an alternative to Labour

item.description: Washington has transformed from the system’s global custodian to treating nations as pliable instruments

item.title: The argument Iranians have in private
item.description: Do social freedoms come via resistance to the Islamic regime or are they concessions that will ensure its survival?

item.description: The country has stored goods worth roughly the combined market cap of its three most globally known corporate names

item.description: Corporate governance reforms are spurring a sharp re-rating of local shares with the Kospi index up 69% this year

item.description: Hollywood studio wants Larry Ellison to offer an airtight personal guarantee, like the Tesla boss did with Twitter

item.description: Senior members of the German far-right visited Washington last week in an effort to cement relations with the GOP
